docs.lead_paragraph: A new method for analyzing newborns’ genetic histories sped the process of zeroing in on a disease-causing mutation from weeks or months to a couple of days.

headline.seo: New Test of Babies’ DNA Speeds Diagnosis
headline.main: Infant DNA Tests Speed Diagnosis of Rare Diseases
headline.print_headline: Rapid Analysis of Infants’ DNA Aids Diagnosis of Rare Diseases

docs.abstract: New method of quickly scanning a newborn baby's entire DNA to pinpoint disease-causing mutation is published in journal Science Translational Medicine; study's authors say that technique, which provides results in days rather than the typical weeks or months, could be one of the first practical fruits of the revolution in sequencing an individual's entire DNA.
docs.snippet: A new method for analyzing newborns’ genetic histories sped the process of zeroing in on a disease-causing mutation from weeks or months to a couple of days.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health officials suspect that a contaminated drug is to blame for the outbreak that has killed two people and sickened a dozen others.

headline.seo: Meningitis Cases Are Linked to Steroid Injections
headline.main: Meningitis Cases Are Linked to Steroid Injections in Spine
headline.print_headline: Meningitis Cases Are Linked To Steroid Injections in Spine

docs.abstract: Health officials suspect that a contaminated steroid drug is to blame for the meningitis outbreak that has killed two people and sickened a dozen others in Tennessee and North Carolina; patients had received spinal injections for pain.
docs.snippet: Health officials suspect that a contaminated drug is to blame for the outbreak that has killed two people and sickened a dozen others.
